title: Equation format
text: The equation format is $$y=mx+b$$ where $$m$$ is the slope and $$b$$ is the y-intercept.
speech: The equation format is  y is equal to m x plus, b  where  m  is the slope and  b  is the y-intercept.
pacedSpeech: The equation format is   y is equal to m x plus, b

title: Slope
text: Substitute the slope value into the equation. You should be left with $$y=\frac{2}{5} x+b$$. You can eliminate options that don't have $$\frac{2}{5}$$ as a slope
speech: Substitute the slope value into the equation. You should be left with  y is equal to, 2 fifths x plus b . You can eliminate options that don't have  2 fifths  as a slope
pacedSpeech: Substitute the slope value into the equation. You should be left with   y is equal to, 2 fifths x plus b
. You can eliminate options that don't have   2 fifths

title: Y-intercept
text: Substitute the y-value into the equation. You should be left with $$y=\frac{2}{5} x+4$$
speech: Substitute the y-value into the equation. You should be left with , y is equal to, 2 fifths x plus 4
pacedSpeech: Substitute the y-value into the equation. You should be left with  , y is equal to, 2 fifths x plus 4
